result.execSummary:
The defendant Randall M Hoffman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Letter from the court for sentence credit w/attachments

Defendant, Randall M Hoffman appeared(w/sister Connie Tesky at the defense table).  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victims rights complied with.  Court advises to rights of an attorney - FVI. Deft enters a plea of no contest to 15CM101 - Count 1
15CF209 Count 1 - DRI.  Enters a plea of no contest to Count 2(amended), 3&4   15CF244 - Enters a plea of no contest to Count 1 amended and Count 2   Count 3 DRI.

Court orders:
15CF209:
24 months probation w/held
  Court Costs and any applicable assessments, fees and surcharges due the court.
  Counseling as deemed necessary by agent.
  Take all prescribed medications
  DNA sample unless already done.
15CF244:
24 months probation w/held
  Court Costs and any applicable assessments, fees and surcharges due the court.
  Counseling as deemed necessary by agent.
  AODA assessment and treatment
 AODA assessment and treatment


15CM101:
12 months probation
  Court Costs and any applicable assessments, fees and surcharges due the court.
AODA assessment and treatment 
Counseling as deemed necessary by agent.  
Shall not consume or possess alcoholic beverages or go on tavern/bar premises

records.descr: DE competent to stand trial, suspension lifted

records.addlTxt:
Case called Appearances given at 2:29 pm.  Trouble with video.  Victim rights have been complied with.  Deft feels that he is competent to proceed.   Adrianne McGlynn   duly sworn and testifies.  Doctor McGlynn feels that the deft can be discharged and if the court were to discharge would not have to return to Mendota.    Deft does not have any questions.  Court questions the deft.

Court rules to find the deft competent and releases him from the committment.  Court proceedings will start in the three cases.  Doctor informs the court the deft needs to stay on the medication.  Court orders continued administration of medications.  Bond is amended to a signature bond 

State addresses the court.  And would like to do the agreement and take the pleas.  .  Sister Connie Teske (sister) addresses the court.  Court rules to amend the bond in 15CM244 to a sign bond and removes the cash.  Court to schedule the plea and sentencing.
from Mendota Mental Health Institution for a Hearing regarding competency on 8/10/16 @ 2:00 pm

Defendant Randall M Hoffman in court, in custody by video.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called appearances given.  Victim rights have been complied with.  No attorney has been obtained.  Deft's moth MFH in the courtroom.  Dr Michael Galli  duly sworn and testifies.  Dr Galli has found the deft incompetent to proceed in the court proceedings.   Dr Galli has identified the deft on the video.  Court asks the deft if he has any questions.  State addresses the court.  Court rules to order an Order of Commitment to Inpatient treatment on all charges in the three cases.  Court finds the deft incompetent to proceed at this time could be restored within a year.  Proceedings are suspended at this time in all cases.  
Days credit at follows: zero days in 15CF209; one day in 15CM101 and 215 days in 15CF244.  Court signs the necessary orders at this time.
Competency hearing on May 16, 2016 at 10:15 am.

Defendant Randall M Hoffman in court, in custody.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All three cases called.  Appearances given.  Victim righs complied with.  Court addresses the deft as to the receiving of the report.  Clerk made copy of the report for the deft.  Deft to review the report.  Connie Teske (sister of deft) is questioned by the court.  Court addresses the sister.  Will need to schedule more time for this case.  For the next hearing we will need the Doctor who wrote the report to appear in person.
Competency hearing on May 9, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Randall M Hoffman in court, in custody.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called appearances given.  Deft still does not have an attorney.  Deft will not listen to the  court as to how to get an attorney. State requests the court to order that Dr Galli do a review of the deft.  Deft is off his meds.  Court files an order for competency review.

Defendant Randall M Hoffman in court, in custody.  Donald James Dunphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called appearances given.  Victims rights have been complied with.  Court addresses the deft.  Deft states that the deft is waiting to hear from Attorney Hersil.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 11, 2016 at 08:00 am.

Defendant Randall M Hoffman in court, in custody with attorney John M. Bliss.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called appearances given.  Discussion on the record.  Attorney will be going to the jail to speak with the deft regarding a global resolution.
And Motion for the Production of Exculpatory Evidence
And Demand for Discovery and Inspection
Defendant Randall M Hoffman in court, in custody.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling conference scheduled for November 19, 2015 at 08:00 am.
Cases called.  Deft is currently in custody.  Court questions the deft regarding an attorney.  Court schedules a scheduling conference to set Jury Trial and status conference.
denied by the court.  Deft did apply at the Public Defenders office

Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for October 29, 2015 at 09:10 am.

Defendant Randall M Hoffman in court, in custody by video.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deft missed pre-trial today.  Deft  has $223 in his jail account and can post the remaining  Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for August 27, 2015 at 08:55 am.

Defendant Randall M Hoffman in court, in custody.  Donald James Dunphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court inquires as to why defendant was not at PSC - Defendant states "he didn't go" - State requests cash - Warrant quashed - Court sets $500 cash  Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for August 13, 2015 at 08:50 am.
Defendant Randall M Hoffman not in court.  Donald James Dunphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant did not appear for PSC - Warrant authorized

Defendant Randall M Hoffman in court, in custody.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint read to the deft.  Attorney rights advised  Not guilty plea entered Bond Set  Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 09:40 am.
